TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EventSource extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

summary.span: 提供建立 Windows 事件追蹤 (ETW) 事件的能力。

span.span: Provides the ability to create events for event tracing for Windows (ETW).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個類別被要提供特定用於 ETW 事件的使用者類別繼承。This class is intended to be inherited by a user class that provides specific events to be used for ETW. 方法會呼叫以記錄的事件。The methods are called to log the events. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此類型會實作介面。This type implements the interface. 當您完成使用型別時，您應該處置它直接或間接。When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接處置型別，呼叫其方法中的`try` / `catch`區塊。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要處置它間接，使用的語言建構這類`using`（在 C# 中) 或`Using`（在 Visual Basic)。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 「 使用物件，實作 IDisposable 」 一節介面 > 主題。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. 基本功能就足以應付大部分的應用程式。The basic functionality of is sufficient for most applications. 如果您想要更充分掌控所建立的 ETW 資訊清單，您可以套用屬性的方法。If you want more control over the ETW manifest that is created, you can apply the attribute to the methods. 針對進階級項目來源的應用程式，就可以攔截到衍生的事件來源正在傳送的命令，並變更篩選，或造成動作 （例如傾印的資料結構） 要執行的繼承。For advanced event source applications, it is possible to intercept the commands being sent to the derived event source and change the filtering, or to cause actions (such as dumping a data structure) to be performed by the inheritor. 可以與 Windows ETW 控制站，例如 Logman 工具，立即啟動事件來源。An event source can be activated with Windows ETW controllers, such as the Logman tool, immediately. 也可以以程式設計方式控制和攔截資料發送器的位置。It is also possible to programmatically control and intercept the data dispatcher. 類別提供額外的功能。The class provides additional functionality. 開頭[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，提供放寬通道支援和一些事件來源的驗證規則。Starting with [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], provides channel support and some of the event source validation rules have been relaxed. 這表示：This means: - 類型現在可能會實作介面。 types may now implement interfaces. 這會啟用事件來源類型的進階的記錄系統中使用介面定義通用的記錄目標。This enables the use of event source types in advanced logging systems that use interfaces to define a common logging target. - 已導入的公用程式的事件來源類型的概念。The concept of a utility event source type has been introduced. 這項功能可讓共用的程式碼分散到多個事件來源型別在專案中啟用的案例，例如最佳化多載。This feature enables sharing code across multiple event source types in a project to enable scenarios such as optimized overloads. 針對新版類別，可提供功能，例如通道可支援您的目標[!INCLUDE[net_v451](~/includes/net-v451-md.md)]或更早版本，請參閱[Microsoft EventSource 程式庫 1.0.16](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource)。For a version of the class that provides features such as channel support you are targeting [!INCLUDE[net_v451](~/includes/net-v451-md.md)] or earlier, see [Microsoft EventSource Library 1.0.16](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource). ## Examples 下列範例示範的簡單實作類別。The following example shows a simple implementation of the class. [!code-csharp[ETWTraceSmall#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/etwtracesmall/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ETWTraceSmall#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/etwtracesmall/vb/program.vb#1)] 下列範例示範的更複雜的實作類別。The following example shows a more complex implementation of the class. [!code-csharp[ETWTrace#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/etwtrace/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ETWTrace#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/etwtrace/vb/program.vb#1)]

summary.span: 釋放 類別目前的執行個體所使用的全部資源。

span.span: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `Dispose` 使用完畢時，請呼叫 。Call `Dispose` when you are finished using the . `Dispose` 方法會將 保留在無法使用的狀態。The `Dispose` method leaves the in an unusable state. 之後呼叫`Dispose`，您必須釋放所有的參考讓記憶體回收行程可以回收記憶體，所佔用。After calling `Dispose`, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 < [ 清除 Unmanaged 資源向上](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)並[實作 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). > [!NOTE] > 在您釋放最後一個 `Dispose` 參考之前，請務必呼叫 。Always call `Dispose` before you release your last reference to the . 否則工作窗格所使用的資源不會釋放，直到記憶體回收行程呼叫 物件的 `Finalize` 方法。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's `Finalize` method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會呼叫公用`Dispose()`方法和`Finalize`方法。This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the `Finalize` method. `Dispose()` 叫用受保護`Dispose(Boolean)`方法`disposing`參數設為`true`。`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. `Finalize` 叫用`Dispose`具有`disposing`設定為`false`。`Finalize` invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`. `disposing` 參數為 `true` 時，這個方法會釋放 參考的任何 Managed 物件所掌握的資源。When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. 這個方法會叫用每個參考物件的 `Dispose()` 方法。This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

para.span: 可以被其他物件呼叫多次。

span.span: can be called multiple times by other objects.

para.span: 覆寫時，請小心不要參考物件已處置過在先前的工作階段 Dispose 方法呼叫。

span.span: When overriding , be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed in an earlier the Dispose Method call to .

para.span: 如需有關如何實作，請參閱 <<c2> [ 實作 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。

span.span: For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).

para.span: 如需詳細資訊並，請參閱[清除 Unmanaged 資源總](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。

span.span: For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 呼叫轉送的命令回呼。Calling forwards the command to the callback. 什麼與命令和其引數是特有的事件來源。What the does with the command and its arguments is specific to the event source. 此命令，命令列引數傳遞至指定的事件來源的回呼。The command and command arguments are passed to the callback of the specified event source. 可能的話，目前的事件來源應該不會影響其他事件接聽程式的篩選事件，不過，所可能無法如果此命令會導致進行記憶體回收、 排清，系統或其他一些通用的活動。If possible, the current event source should not affect other event listeners' filtering events; however, that may not be possible if the command causes a garbage collection, a system flush, or some other global activity.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `eventid` 應大於 0 或小於 65535，或在作業中，可能會發生錯誤。`eventid` should be greater than 0 or less than 65535 or errors can occur in the operation. 如果發生錯誤，您可以取得錯誤來源的詳細資訊，藉由檢查輸出資料流的偵錯工具中，如果您有偵錯工具附加至處理程序引發的事件即可。If errors do occur, you can get more information about the source of the error by checking the output stream of the debugger, if you have a debugger attached to the process firing events. 如果您有在發生錯誤的事件來源的 ETW 接聽程式，您也可以尋找 ETW 事件資料流中報告錯誤。You can also look for errors reported in the ETW event stream, if you have an ETW listener on the event source where the error occurs. 當您實作的方法，便會被視為中的 ETW 事件-衍生的類別。When you implement a method that is identified as an ETW event in an -derived class. 您必須呼叫基底類別方法並傳遞和實作的方法類似於下列範例中相同引數。You must call the base class method passing the and the same arguments as the implemented method similar to the following example. ```csharp [Event(2, Level = EventLevel.Informational)] public void Info1(string arg1) { base.WriteEvent(2, arg1); } ``` ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用這個方法多載來寫入事件。The following example shows how to use this method overload to write an event. 此程式碼範例是針對提供之較大範例的一部分類別。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 根據預設，編譯器會呼叫這個多載，如果呼叫的參數不符合其中一個其他方法多載。By default, the compiler calls this overload if the parameters for the call do not match one of the other method overloads. 這個多載會比其他的多載，慢很多，因為它會執行下列作業：This overload is much slower than the other overloads, because it does the following: 1. 它會配置的陣列，用以保存的變數引數。It allocates an array to hold the variable argument. 2. 它會轉換至物件 （這會導致配置基本型別） 的每個參數。It casts each parameter to an object (which causes allocations for primitive types). 3. 它會將這些物件指派給陣列中。It assigns these objects to the array. 4. 它會呼叫函式，然後決定每個引數的型別，讓它可以序列化來加以 ETW。It calls the function, which then determines the type of each argument so it can be serialized for ETW. 這個多載的高額外負荷並不重要時追蹤少量事件，因為只有當啟用提供者時使用的方法。The high overhead for this overload is not significant when tracing low-volume events, because the method is used only when the provider is enabled. 不過，對於高容量事件，效能負擔很可觀。However, for high-volume events, the performance overhead can be significant. 您可以避免使用藉由建立全新、 更快速的多載，以大量承載的方法。You can avoid using for high-volume payloads by creating a new, faster overload with the method. `eventid` 應大於 0 或小於 65535，或在作業中，可能會發生錯誤。`eventid` should be greater than 0 or less than 65535 or errors can occur in the operation. 如果發生錯誤，您可以取得錯誤來源的詳細資訊，藉由檢查輸出資料流的偵錯工具中，如果您有偵錯工具附加至處理程序引發的事件即可。If errors do occur, you can get more information about the source of the error by checking the output stream of the debugger, if you have a debugger attached to the process firing events. 如果您有在發生錯誤的事件來源的 ETW 接聽程式，您也可以尋找 ETW 事件資料流中報告錯誤。You can also look for errors reported in the ETW event stream, if you have an ETW listener on the event source where the error occurs. 當您實作的方法，便會被視為中的 ETW 事件-衍生的類別。When you implement a method that is identified as an ETW event in an -derived class. 您必須呼叫基底類別方法並傳遞和實作的方法類似於下列範例中相同引數。You must call the base class method passing the and the same arguments as the implemented method similar to the following example. ```csharp [Event(2, Level = EventLevel.Informational)] public void Info1(string arg1) { base.WriteEvent(2, arg1); } ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法會記錄傳輸事件。The method logs a transfer event. 目前執行緒的活動會記錄與事件，而這讓兩個活動相關的事件取用者。The activity of the current thread is logged with the event, and this allows two activities to be related by a consumer of events. 您呼叫此函式的 ETW 事件方法必須遵循這些指導方針：Your ETW event method calling this function must follow these guidelines: 1. 第一個參數指定為名為`relatedActivityId`。Specify the first parameter as a named `relatedActivityId`. 2. 指定或是做為屬性。Specify either or as the property. 3. 呼叫傳遞的事件識別碼相關的識別碼 GUID，後面接著的所有參數的事件方法中傳遞，以相同的順序。Call passing in the event ID, followed by the related ID GUID, followed by all the parameters the event method is passed, in the same order. 如果`args`是未使用，則會轉換成 ETW 產生呼叫的空陣列。If `args` is not used, it is converted to an empty array for the resulting call to ETW. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例顯示如何可能會指定事件來源呼叫。The following code example shows how you might can specify an event source that calls . remarks.format: ## Remarks 類似於方法，還提供更佳的效能，並沒有要 unbox 的 bevcause`childActivityID`和`data`引數。 is similar to the method but offers better performance, bevcause it does not have to unbox the `childActivityID` and `data` arguments. 您呼叫此函式的 ETW 事件方法必須遵循這些指導方針：Your ETW event method calling this function must follow these guidelines: 1. 第一個參數指定為名為`relatedActivityId`。Specify the first parameter as a named `relatedActivityId`. 2. 指定或是做為屬性。Specify either or as the property. 3. 呼叫傳遞的事件識別碼相關的識別碼 GUID，後面接著的所有參數的事件方法中傳遞，以相同的順序。Call passing in the event ID, followed by the related ID GUID, followed by all the parameters the event method is passed, in the same order. ## Examples 下列 C# 程式碼範例示範如何定義呼叫的方法多載。The following C# code example shows how to define a method overload that calls .
